products.name: deploy-arch-landing-zone-code-engine
products.label: Landing zone for serverless workloads with IBM Code Engine
products.short_description: Provision scalable, serverless workloads with integrated IBM Cloud services.
products.long_description:
This solution enables the provisioning of [IBM Code Engine](https://www.ibm.com/products/code-engine) projects on IBM Cloud using a range of configurations—from compute-intensive workloads to future support for broader serverless patterns. Each variation offers a distinct balance of automation, integration with IBM Cloud services, and readiness for experimentation or production use. 

The current variation supports high-performance tasks like Monte Carlo simulations, PDF conversion with Doclin, and batch processing using VPC and COS. 

It automates both Code Engine setup and the supporting IBM Cloud infrastructure for full end-to-end deployment. Whether you're running intensive jobs or exploring other serverless architectures, this landing zone helps accelerate your cloud-native journey.

features.title: Flexible Deployment Variations
features.description: Supports a growing set of configurations tailored to specific workload types—from compute-intensive tasks to future support for event-driven jobs and transactional applications.

features.title: End-to-End Automation
features.description: Provisions both IBM Code Engine components (applications, builds, secrets, access policies) and supporting IBM Cloud infrastructure for a complete deployment experience.

features.title: IBM Cloud Service Integrations
features.description: Seamless integration with Secrets Manager, Container Registry, Activity Tracker, IBM Cloud Logs, and IBM Cloud Monitoring.

features.title: Simplified Setup with Guided Inputs
features.description: Preconfigured defaults and guided parameter selection (e.g., region, availability zones, service plans) reduce manual setup and accelerate deployment.

features.description: Ideal for users running distributed container-based tasks with minimal setup, such as Monte Carlo simulations, PDF conversion with Doclin, or batch processing with VPC and COS integration.

Automates deployment of a scalable Code Engine Fleet with integrated IBM Cloud services. Guided inputs for region, zones, and service plans—plus preconfigured defaults—enable a ready-to-run environment for execution, storage, and observability, without manual networking or service setup.

diagram.caption: Fleet-Based Workload Topology with IBM Cloud Code Engine

diagrams.description:
This architecture provides a streamlined setup within an IBM Cloud region to deploy and manage fleet-based workloads using IBM Cloud Code Engine. It introduces a Fleet managed by Code Engine as the core execution environment, with worker instances (VSIs) dynamically provisioned in Code Engine–managed accounts based on a customer-provided VSI image.

A Task State Store, implemented using IBM Cloud Object Storage (COS), handles task and data persistence. Logs generated by the fleet workers are ingested into an IBM Cloud Logs instance, enabling centralized observability and simplified monitoring.

Designed for scalability and operational efficiency, this Quick Start automates the provisioning of required IBM Cloud services using well-chosen defaults. Users provide minimal input—such as region, availability zones, and service plans—while Code Engine handles the lifecycle of Fleets, Tasks, and Workers.

This solution accelerates deployment of distributed, container-based workloads without requiring manual setup of networking, storage, or observability components, making it ideal for rapid experimentation and workload execution on IBM Cloud.
